page.title: 01BRADGATE PARK AND ENVIRONS.
page.content: Domesday map reference:04520309. This area is dominated by {Bradgate {Park}. The 1000 acre park is approximately 6 miles from the centre of Leicester. It bracken covered hills and Cambrian volcanic granite outcrop along with the herds of grazing red and fallow deer make this area an extremely popular destination for visitors. The house once occupied by { {Lady Jane Grey}is now in ruins but the small chapel houses an interesting museum. Visitors to the park usually pass through the picturesque village of{ {Newtown Linford}with its thatched cottages and parish church. The other village near by is{Cropston}set beside the scenic reservoir. The block is predominantly rural. There is a primary and secondary school on the outskirts of{Anstey}.
